briefTitle: ADSTILADRIN (=INSTILADRIN) in Patients With High-Grade, Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) Unresponsive Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer (NMIBC)
officialTitle: A Phase III, Open Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of INSTILADRINÂ® (rAd-IFN)/Syn3) Administered Intravesically to Patients With High-Grade, BCG Unresponsive Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer (NMIBC)
summary: Previous multi-dose Phase I and Phase II clinical studies have demonstrated that ADSTILADRIN is a safe and effective treatment for BCG-refractory and recurrent NMIBC. This Phase III study is designed to expand those observations using a high dose of ADSTILADRIN in patients that are "BCG Unresponsive" which refers to patients with high-grade NMIBC who are unlikely to benefit from and should not receive further intravesical BCG.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Patients With a Complete Response Rate Based on Patients With Carcinoma in Situ (CIS), With or Without Concomitant High-grade Ta or T1 Papillary Disease.
